meanings.definition: To make fun of or provoke someone in a playful way.
meanings.sent1: She likes to tease her little brother by hiding his toys.
meanings.sent2: The children would often tease each other during recess.
meanings.sent3: The friends would tease each other about their funny dance moves.
meanings.sent4: His mischievous smile seemed to tease the truth out of her.
meanings.sent5: The playful banter between them was filled with teasing remarks.

meanings.definition: To separate fibers or threads by brushing or combing.
meanings.sent1: She would gently tease the knots out of her hair.
meanings.sent2: The stylist used a special comb to tease out the tangles.
meanings.sent3: The cat would playfully tease at the yarn with its claws.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to tease the strands of her hair, blowing them in all directions.
meanings.sent5: Her fingers deftly teased the wool into a soft, fluffy texture.

meanings.definition: A person who tempts or entices someone sexually.
meanings.sent1: He was known as a tease among his friends for his charming ways.
meanings.sent2: The character in the movie was portrayed as a seductive tease.
meanings.sent3: The flirtatious tease at the party caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: She had a reputation as a dangerous tease, leading many admirers on.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious stranger had an aura of allure, a true tease to those around.
